com.opentok
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  com.opentok.Session

public abstract class Session
extends Object

The first step in using the OpenTok Android SDK is to initialize a Session instance is with a valid API key, session ID, and token. Use the Session#newInstance(String sessionId, String token, String apiKey, Listener listener) method to create a Session object.

You get an API key when you sign up for an OpenTok account. For test purposes, you can generate test session IDs and tokens using the Generate Sessions and Tokens page. Use the OpenTok server-side libraries to generate session IDs and tokens in your shipping app.

See Also:
Session Creation, Token Creation

          Monitors state changes of a Session instance.

Method Detail

newInstance

public static Session newInstance(Context context,
                                  String sessionId,
                                  String token,
                                  String apiKey,
                                  Session.Listener listener)
Use this factory method to create a Session instance.

Parameters:
context - The Android application context associated with this process.
sessionId - The OpenTok session ID this instance should connect to.
token - Authentication token required to connect to this session.
apiKey - The partner ID for this application.
listener - A listener to respond to state changes on the session.
Returns:
A new Session object.

connect

public void connect()
Connects to the OpenTok session provided by newInstance(Context, String, String, String, Listener), using the provided authentication token.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnects from this session. All Subscriber and Publisher instances will be disconnected.

createPublisher

public abstract Publisher createPublisher(Camera camera,
                                          int cameraFacingId,
                                          SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder)
Creates a publisher bound to this Session. Publishers cannot be reused.

Parameters:
camera - The Camera instance that will supply video for this Publisher.
cameraFacingId - The selected camera id (front or back)
surfaceHolder - A SurfaceHolder for the Camera to draw with. Camera data cannot be captured without a preview surface.
Returns:
A new Publisher instance, or null if an error occurs.

createSubscriber

public abstract Subscriber createSubscriber(SurfaceView subscriberView,
                                            Stream stream)
Creates a subscriber attached to a stream descriptor. Subscribers cannot be reused.

Parameters:
subscriberView - The SurfaceView this subscriber will draw video frames on.
stream - The Stream the new subscriber will bind to.
Returns:
A new Subscriber instance, bound to stream.
See Also:
Session.Listener.onSessionDidReceiveStream(Stream)

getSessionId

public String getSessionId()
Gets the Session ID passed in during instantiation.

Returns:
The OpenTok Session ID for this instance.
See Also:
newInstance(Context, String, String, String, Listener)

getConnection

public Connection getConnection()
